chargeHist.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>3-10g)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession w/ Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>3-10g)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin T. Martine

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:46 AM cases 22CF1029, 22CF742 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin T. Martine in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.

22CF1029 Initial Appearance: Defense waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. Bond is set. 

22CF742: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Branch 1 for further scheduling. New 22CF1029 is to ride along.

1:31 PM Defendant Justin T. Martine in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Justin T. Martine.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing.
State calls Officer Sam Sperry, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Officer identifies Defendant. 
Defense cross examines Officer Sperry. 
Witness is excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over to Br. 1 for further scheduling.

9:33 AM case called and held via Zoom.  Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin T. Martine in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Justin T. Martine. There is an offer from the State but no agreement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:14 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin T. Martine appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler appeared by video for Justin T. Martine.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 25, 2022 at 2:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
